tn.text: Here "brothers" means fellow Christians.
Paul uses "encourage" and "exhort" to emphasize how strongly they encourage the believers. AT: "we strongly encourage you" (See:  [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "we taught you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "walk" is an expression for the way one is to live. AT: "you ought to live"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Paul speaks of his instructions as if they were given by Jesus himself. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"you stay away from sexually immoral acts"
Possible meanings are 1) how to live with your wife or 2) how to live a self-discipline life or 3) how to live with your virgin daughter.
"with wrongful sexual desire"
Here "man" refers to a man or a woman. "no one" or "no person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_gendernotations]])
This is a doublet stating the same idea in two ways to reinforce the concept. AT: "wrong" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
This can be made explicit. AT: "the Lord will punish the one who transgressed and will defend the one who was wronged" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"told you beforehand and strongly warned against"

tn.ref: God did not call us to uncleanness, but to holiness
tn.text: This can be stated in positive form. AT: "God called us to cleanness and holiness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
The word "us" refers to all believers. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])
"whoever disregards this teaching" or "whoever ignores this teaching"
Paul stresses that this teaching is not from man, but from God.
"love for fellow believers"

tn.ref: you do this for all the brothers who are in all Macedonia
tn.text: "you show love to the believers throughout Macedonia"
Here "brothers" means fellow Christians.
"to try to"
Paul uses the word "quietly" as a metaphor to describe living at peace in one's community and not causing strife. AT: "live in a calm and orderly way" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This idiom means to pay attention to your own concerns, not other people's. AT: "attend to your own needs" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is a metaphor for living a productive life. AT: "work at your own jobs to earn what you need to live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This metaphor describes how believers should relate to those in their communities. AT: "behave in a respectful and worthy manner" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: those who are outside the faith
tn.text: "those who are not believers in Christ." Paul speaks of "the faith" as if it were a place. Here "the faith" refers to those who trust in Christ. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Paul talks about believers who have died, who are still alive, and those who will be alive when Christ returns.

tn.ref: We do not want you to misunderstand
tn.text: This can be stated in positive form. AT: "We want you to understand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
Here "brothers" means fellow Christians.
Here "sleep" is a euphemism for those who are dead. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
"you do not mourn"

tn.ref: like the rest who do not have certainty about the future
tn.text: "like the people who do not believe"
Here "we" refers to Paul and his audience. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])
"rose to live again"

tn.ref: those who have fallen asleep in him
tn.text: Here "fallen asleep" is a polite way to refer to having died. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: at the coming of the Lord
tn.text: "at the day of Christ's return"
"will surely not go before"
"the Lord himself will come down"
"the chief angel"

tn.ref: the dead in Christ will rise first
tn.text: The "dead in Christ" are those believers who have passed away. AT: "those who believe in Jesus Christ, but who have already died, will rise first" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Here "we" refers to all believers who have not died. (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])
The word "them" refers to the dead believers who were made alive again.

tn.ref: caught up in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air
tn.text: "meet the Lord Jesus in the sky"
